communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All invoices, purchases orders, contracts, loan agreements, statements of work, procurement documents (but not limited to solicitation documents or notices of proposed contracts, proposed bids, unsolicited proposals, and/or documents justifying contracting without full and open competition) relating to the following specific procurement identifiers:

Award ID: 70CMSD24FR0000191
Reference IDV ID: 70B04C19D00000021

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a journalist writing for The Latino Newsletter, a new media outlet focused on Puerto Rico and that this request is being made as part of news gathering.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Austin McGeough Investigation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The investigative case file associated with the  October 15, 2016 death of 21-year-old Austin McGeough, who was fatally struck by vehicles on Hwy 41A. 

Records should include but are not limited to:
All 911 calls, recorded statements, and emergency call logs
Incident report (initial)
Supplemental reports
Records of any official action taken that are associated with the case file
Autopsy report/coroner's verdict/medical examiner findings
Photographs or visual evidence related to the case, including of the victim and crime scene
Crime scene diagrams
Arrest records and/or police blotter records associated with the case
Records of communication or coordination with other law enforcement agencies, search and rescue teams, or other organizations involved with search efforts
ViCAP summary report
CAD event sheet, if applicable
Media communications, including press releases
Witness interviews and statements
Audio and/or video files attached to case file (eg Witness statements, bodycam and dashcam video, etc...)
Lead sheets
Search warrants and/or complaints for search warrants
Field notes
Evidence logs

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Courteney Stuart.

title: FOIA Request: DHS + FEC – Election Security and Social Media Platforms (Federal Election Commission)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I respectfully request access to and copies of the following records:

All communications (including but not limited to emails, meeting notes, memos, call logs, reports, or briefings) between officials of the Department of Homeland Security and representatives of Meta (Facebook, Instagram), X (formerly Twitter), TikTok, YouTube, or Google regarding misinformation, disinformation, deepfakes, or the use of artificial intelligence (AI) tools in relation to elections.

The timeframe for this request is January 1, 2024 through the present.

Please include both internal analyses or assessments generated by DHS regarding the effectiveness of platform cooperation on election security, as well as any external communications with the Federal Election Commission (FEC) that reference the above topics.

This request covers materials at all relevant sub-agencies, including but not limited to CISA (Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency).

I request expedited processing on the grounds that the records sought involve matters of significant public interest: the integrity of U.S. elections and the use of emerging AI technologies in shaping the information environment.

I am willing to pay reasonable fees for search and duplication, but please notify me first if the estimated costs exceed $100. If possible, I request the responsive documents be provided in electronic format.

Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dan Costa

title: Kevin Riford Black Mail & Extortion Report - ic3 reports/complaints (ic3.gov) (AI Deepfakes & Bitcoin extortion)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Kevin Riford Black Mail & Extortion Report - ic3 reports/complaints (ic3.gov) (AI Deepfakes & Bitcoin extortion)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On 9/14/2025, Kevin Riford submitted two complaints on ic3.gov, although he did report these occurrences to the FBI Tip hotline as well. I am requesting copies of the following complaints

1.) 9/14/2025 complaint by Kevin Riford (submission ID ending in 0533a) which states "I was sent an email indicating that a person(s) have 18 hours of video/audio of me regarding a podcast that I've been on numerous times. This email indicated they plan on using artificial intelligence (AI) of me to AI my voice and video. I am worried that this person(s) may make a deepfake of me doing or saying something I did not do."

2.) 9/14/2025 complaint by Kevin Riford (submission ID ending in 8e69b) which states "I received an email on August 20, 2025 from littledickie007@protonmail.com regarding a ransom of $500 bitcoin USD. They wanted me to pay within 3 days and threatened to release files of mine. If I paid, they said they would delete the files. They showed a screenshot of my desktop. I contacted FBI tip hotline and they said to not pay the ransom."

I've enclosed enclosed the complaints and e-mails. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Traffic Arrests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the [State] Public Records Act, I request copies of police reports for all traffic stops conducted by the [Police Department] between August 1, 2025 and August 7, 2025 that resulted in an arrest. If no arrest please widen search from August 1, 2025 and August 31, 2025.

If the department cannot search by stop type, please instead provide:

The arrest log for the same dates; and The corresponding incident or arrest reports for those arrests that originated from a traffic stop.

Please provide these records in electronic format of PDF or Word/Excel. If any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, please redact only the exempt material and release all reasonably segregable portions of the record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: [Public Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of Sept 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of Sept 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3a. Flock networks shared with me

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please send a copy of the invoice for the appraisal provided to the Lake Geneva city council members on July 14,2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gary Milliette

Hello,

The City is in receipt of your open records request. Please be aware of the following if applicable:
•	The charge for copies of records is 25 cents per side of page.
•	The charge for any other media is at the actual cost.
•	Pursuant to 19.35(3)(f), Wis. Stats., if the amount to be imposed is more than $5.00, the authority may require prepayment. 
•	Pursuant to Section 19.35(3)(c), Wis. Stats., if the cost to locate the record will cost more than $50.00, the authority may require payment of the location costs. 
•	If a record request response is mailed, the authority may charge the actual postage amount, to be paid before mailing.
•	The City is not obligated to provide records in the format requested. Grebner v. Schiebel, 2001 WI App 17, 240 Wis.2d 551.
•	The City is not obligated to provide records in a time frame established by the requester. Reasonableness of the response time is determined by the volume of records requested, the ability to locate the records, review of records for possible redaction, and other work assignments. Journal Times v. City of Racine Bd. of Police & Fire Comm’rs, 2015 WI 56, 362 Wis.2d 577; WIREdata Inc. v. Village of Sussex, 2008 WI 69, 310 Wis.2d 397.
We are in the process of evaluating your request and will provide further information as it becomes available. 

Thank you,

Vanessa Jahns
 
Deputy City Clerk

title: Enterprise Data Inventory (EDI) (Bureau of Land Management)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Your Enterprise Data Inventory (EDI), as described in federal guidance https://resources.data.gov/assets/documents/CDOC_Data_Inventory_Report_Final.pdf?trk=public_post_comment-text, in a machine-readable database or spreadsheet format such as Excel, CSV, Access or SQL. 

I also request all documentation that describes the layout of the database’s tables and fields, and that provides the definitions of any field names, codes, and abbreviations used in the database. This information may be gathered together in a single document like a data dictionary, entity layout, or user's guide. If that is the case, I request access to and copy of said document.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin
